div.p: SITUATION NOT APPROPRIATELY CONTROLLED OR LACKING APPROPRIATE ORDERLY:order.
1. The very dominant word in this group is luàn 亂 (ant. zhì 治 "state of good government, state of good order") which refers to all kinds of reprehensible lack of order.
2. Èr 二 / 貳 "disunited" (ant. yī 一 "be properly united in attitude") refers to political dissension or duplicity.
3. Fēn 紛 describes a mild form of physical disorder. See CONFUSED.
4. Fén 棼 describes something as unprincipled and disorganised.
5. Wèn 紊 is often inchoative and describes the process by which something concrete or abstract enters a disorderly state.
6. Hún 混 refers to a kind of chaos that is close to objective confusion. See CONFUSED.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: “荀子”單音節形容詞同義關係研究
SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse

sense.def: contrary, perverse; be at odds with each other; be at loggerheads

entry.def: The very dominant word in this group is luàn 亂 (ant. zhì 治 "state of good government, state of good order") which refers to all kinds of reprehensible lack of order.

sense.def: something chaotic; a chaotic state; a chaotic situation, political chaos
ill-governed; disorderly, unruly; chaotic; doomed to chaos; bent on chaos
be in turmoil; be in disorder; be ill-governed
there is political chaos; there was a rebellion
wreak havoc with; cause to be chaotic, reduce to chaos; mix something chaotically into (something else); wreak havoc in; disrupt
the chaos of N, the chaos resulting from; the chaos constituted by
what is unruly; what is conducive to political chaos
a polity in chaos, a chaotic society; a chaotic place

entry.def: Ér 二/貳 "disunited" (ant. yī 一 "be properly united in attitude") refers to political dissension or duplicity.

sense.def: be disunited and not well aligned (HYDZD)

entry.def: Fén 棼 describes something as unprincipled and disorganised.

sense.def: cause to be chaotic; cause to be in disorder

entry.def: Hún 混 refers to a kind of chaos that is close to objective confusion. See CONFUSED.
Fēn 紛 describes a mild form of physical disorder. See CONFUSED.

sense.def: be various, disorderly, and confused; be in a mess
the confusion of the contextually determinate N
in a tumultuous fashion, in disarray

entry.def: Wèn 紊 is often inchoative and describes the process by which something concrete or abstract enters a disorderly state.

sense.def: get into a chaotic state, turn chaotic
create havoc; offend all the rules
be in disarray; be uneven in sizeHYDCD: [1] 不齊貌。《詩 · 周南 · 關雎》：「參差荇菜，左右流之。」
be in chaos; form a chaotic and incomplete whole
the chaotic din of this world (DCD)
have been messed up so as to be in disarray; be in turmoil
run into chaos; get into total disorder
be in chaotic conflict; be in conflict and turmoil
be reduced to chaos XIE LINGYUN
be in a state of chaos
be reduced to a state of chaos
run into chaos, get into chaos
there is unrest; there is revolt; there is misrule
= chán 儳: be in disarray, be uneven
